        • Education Classes & Seminars

          Recommended Link: /sanfrancisco/EventSearch?feature=Recommended

          Stand-Up Paddleboarding Lessons Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/stand-up-paddleboarding-lessons/Event?oid=2571265

          When the ancient Polynesians invented surfing, they often used a paddle to help them navigate. Fast-forward a few millennia, and Stand-Up Paddleboarding, or SUP, finds itself trendy again. Part of its increasing popularity is that standing upright allows surfers to spot waves more easily and thus catch more of them, multiplying the fun factor. Paddling back to the wave becomes less of a strain as well. The ability to cruise along on flat inland water, surveying the sights, is another advantage. Finally, its a good core workout. If youre sold on the idea, schedule an intro SUP lesson, free with board and paddle rental, and you may find yourself riding the waves like a Polynesian king. More Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/stand-up-paddleboarding-lessons/Event?oid=2571265

          Ongoing

          Boardsports Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/boardsports/Location?oid=2195507

          Traci Vogel

        • Visual Arts Craft Events

          Recommended Link: /sanfrancisco/EventSearch?feature=Recommended

          Drop-In Family Ceramics Workshop Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/drop-in-family-ceramics-workshop/Event?oid=2570970

          Many of us remember coming home from our elementary schools with freshly glazed pinchpots, cups, or whatever else our young imaginations could conjure up. Saturday mornings at the Randall Museum can bring that memory back, or create a new one for the youngsters. Ceramics make great gifts — especially on Mothers' and Fathers' Day. Hop on board for the Randall's once-weekly class, and for $6 and two weeks to have your work fired and glazed, you'll have all the materials you need. More Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/drop-in-family-ceramics-workshop/Event?oid=2570970

          Saturdays, 10:15 a.m.

          Randall Museum Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/sanfrancisco/randall-museum/Location?oid=2190192

          Chris Torres

Monday, February 28, 2011

Politics Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/politics/ / Tech Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/tech/ David Chiu: Twitter Fiend Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/david-chiu-twitter-fiend

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 6:11 PM

  • Turning us off with his tweets

After announcing his bid for San Francisco mayor, Link: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/david_chiu_mayor.php Supervisor David Chiu pulled a Mayor Jean Quan on us and started engaging in the obnoxious social networking antics of oversharing with his users. After winning election in November, Oakland Mayor Quan inundated her Twitter followers with 544 tweets Link: http://www.eastbayexpress.com/92510/archives/2010/12/10/jean-quan-apologizes-for-the-twitter-fiasco in a matter of 15 days. Needless to say, her fans grew tired of the nonstop updates-- so much so that she ended up having to tweet out an apology Link: http://twitter.com/#%21/jeanquan . Could the same fate await Chiu, whose Twitter activity picked up noticeably today Link: http://twitter.com/#%21/DavidChiu after he declared his intention to run for San Francisco mayor?

Continue reading » Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/david-chiu-twitter-fiend#more

Politics Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/politics/ Scott Wiener Shuns Predecessor Bevan Dufty, Endorses Dennis Herrera for Mayor Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/scott-wiener-shuns-predecessor-bevan-dufty-endorses-dennis-herrera-for-mayor

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 4:59 PM

  • Not Supervisor Scott Wiener's pick...for mayor

On paper, it would seem to be a dead cert that Supervisor Scott Wiener would endorse his predecessor Bevan Dufty for mayor. They're both gay moderates from District 8 -- and incredibly tall (no, wait, that's just Wiener). Yet the tall one announced today that he is not going to support Dufty, the only openly gay mayoral candidate in the race. Instead Wiener claims that his decision was simple -- as a former deputy city attorney, he's chosen to endorse his erstwhile boss, City Attorney Dennis Herrera Link: http://herreraformayor.com/about/?id=0001 . "It doesn't say anything negative about Bevan Dufty whatsoever," Wiener told SF Weekly. "I think the world of Bevan and I think he would do a really good job."

Continue reading » Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/scott-wiener-shuns-predecessor-bevan-dufty-endorses-dennis-herrera-for-mayor#more

Marijuana Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/marijuana/ / Politics Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/politics/ Steve Kubby, Prop 215 Author, Drafts New initiative to Decriminalize Marijuana Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/steve-kubby-prop-215-author-drafts-new-initiative-to-decriminalize-marijuana

Posted By Chris Roberts Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/chris-roberts on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 4:09 PM

  • Steve Kubby, would-be freer of marijuana
Steve Kubby, would-be freer of marijuana
Steve Kubby has earned his stripes: Before he was a Libertarian Party candidate for governor of California and President of the United States (and South Lake Tahoe City Council Link: http://www.kubby.com/ ), Kubby was a model activist and poster child for the medical cannabis movement. The latter because he has lived with a rare form of adrenal cancer for over 40 years, thanks to medial marijuana, and the former for co-authoring Proposition 215. Link: http://www.kubby.com/DennisPeronLetter.html

Now, Kubby, 64, is circulating a proposed ballot initiative for 2012 that, he told SF Weekly on Monday, can not only succeed where Proposition 19 failed last November, but could lead toward a changed federal policy on marijuana.

Can you say, "No more CAMP Link: http://ag.ca.gov/bne/camp.php helicopters?"

Celebrities Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/celebrities/ Rob Schneider Career Slump May Kill Pacifica Music Program Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/rob-schneider-career-slump-may-kill-pacifica-music-program

Posted By Matt Smith Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/matt-smith on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 3:34 PM

  • Watch this, or watch Pacifica's music program get eliminated

Since the late 1990s comedian Rob Schneider has given around $2 million to music programs in Pacifica, where he played trombone in the school band. Yet a recent career slump has made the actor a little more tight-fisted, and the small coastal town near San Francisco is feeling the effects. "The last couple of years have been very difficult in Hollywood, in getting movies made, and in getting good-paying positions for Rob," said John Bentley, a consultant for the Rob Schneider Music Foundation, Link: http://www.robschneidermusicfoundation.org/contact.php which since the late 1990s provided the main source of funding Link: http://www.guidestar.org/FinDocuments/2009/943/267/2009-943267437-06195672-9.pdf for Pacifica's Link: http://www.pacificasd.org/ middle-school band programs. In a letter to the foundation, Schneider said "he could not be responsible for the programs any longer," Bentley told SF Weekly. The school district will take advantage of stimulus money to make up for the loss this year, said Pacifica School District Superintendent Wendy Tukloff. But after that, there's no money to draw from.

Animals Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/animals/ Chihuahuas Still Crowding Shelters, S.F. to Fly More Pups to New York Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/chihuahuas-still-crowding-shelters-sf-to-fly-more-pups-to-new-york

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 2:56 PM

  • His bags are packed

Last year we told you about the Paris Hilton syndrome Link: http://www.sfweekly.com/2009-04-15/news/paris-hilton-syndrome-hits-sf-animal-control/ that plagued San Francisco's animal shelter as they continued to receive an overflow of homeless Chihuahuas. In hopes of reducing the number to a more manageable amount, they put about two dozen pups on the dog equivalent of a first-class flight to New York City where Chihuahuas were strangely in high demand. But the dogs just kept coming. And as of now, Chihuahuas account for one-third of the shelter's dog population. So tomorrow, the San Francisco Animal Care and Control Center Link: http://www.sfgov2.org/index.aspx?page=942 is sending another dozen Chihuahuas Link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chihuahua_%28dog%29 to the Big Apple, where they expect they will be the "toast of the town." "It's on ongoing problem," said Deb Campbell, spokeswoman for the San Francisco shelter. "We will send 12 off tomorrow and we will probably have another 12 arrive at the shelter by the end of the week.

Local News Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/local-news/ Haight Recycling Center Advocates to Stage Protest Using Recyled Chains Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/haight-recycling-center-advocates-to-stage-protest-using-recyled-chains

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 1:39 PM

  • Preserving a recycling center...does it get more 'earthy' than that?

Leading by example, advocates of the HANC Recycling Center Link: http://www.hanc-sf.org/ in the Haight have pledged to scrounge up used chains so they can literally link themselves to the shuddered center come Friday when it's slated to permanently close. More than 1,000 people are saying they will chain themselves together in an act of civil disobedience that San Francisco hasn't enjoyed in quite some time. "Scrap prices for steel are through the roof so this is a good time to recycle," says Ed Dunn, executive director of HANC Recycling.

Business Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/business/ / Media Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/media/ Anti-North Korea Rally, Inspired by 'Homefront' Video Game, Planned for SF Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/anti-north-korea-rally-inspired-by-homefront-video-game-planned-for-sf

Posted By Peter Jamison Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/peter-jamison on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 11:21 AM

  • Coming Wednesday to Yerba Buena Gardens

This really is a case of life imitating art -- so long as you're willing to permit the "art" classification to be applied to video games. It seems that a rally against North Korea has been orchestrated to take place in San Francisco Wednesday by video-game company THQ, which this month is publishing a shooter game, Homefront, in which players assume the role of American guerrilla fighters challenging North Korean forces that have successfully occupied the United States. The rally, which will begin with a march across the Golden Gate Bridge and

ends with a noon protest at Yerba Buena Gardens, doesn't seem to be

the sort of affair to which you should bring your AK-47. A statement from the company states that the event will draw attention to "North

Korea's human rights violations," and "will include speeches by global

experts, musical performances, and the launch of 10,000 balloons."

Law & Order Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/law-and-order/ Craig Carlos-Valentino, Gun-Toting Man Who Stopped Bay Bridge Traffic, Goes to Jail Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/craig-carlos-valentino-gun-toting-man-who-stopped-bay-bridge-traffic-goes-to-jail

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 11:08 AM

  • Craig Carlos-Valentino

SF Weekly readers might recall the bizarre November incident where Craig Carlos-Valentino Link: http://blogs.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2010/11/gun_bay_bridge.php , a bouncer and father of eight, created a massive Bay Bridge backup when he made a false bomb threat with his daughter in the car. Today, prosecutors announced that he will face one year in prison. On Nov. 11, 2010, the Carlos-Valentino reportedly brandished a gun and claimed he had a bomb, halting the westbound morning commute on the  Bay Bridge for more than two hours. He had tossed a gun -- or a replica of a firearm -- off the side of the Bay Bridge after getting out of his SUV and sitting on the railing. He was seen talking on his cell phone, presumably to radio shows and 911 dispatchers who reported that he was staging the standoff because his wife was planning to leave him and he couldn't deal with it anymore Link: http://mt.laweekly.com/mt-static/html/Aside%20from%20a%20massive%20traffic%20jam,%20Carlos-Valentino%20created%20panic%20when%20he%20staged%20a%20standoff%20with%20his%2016-year-old%20daughter%20in%20the%20car. .

Tech Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/archives/tech/ Reboot: New App Helps Us 'Unplug' From Technology Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/thesnitch/2011/02/28/reboot-new-app-helps-us-unplug-from-technology

Posted By Erin Sherbert Link: https://archives.sfweekly.com/author/erin-sherbert on Mon, Feb 28, 2011 at 8:25 AM

  • there is an app for this

It's a sad commentary when we need an app to remind us to "unplug" from technology. In a bicoastal effort, two nonprofits are asking San Franciscans to dump their cell phones, computers, and iPads for one day this weekend and get back to the good old days of live conversation. Ironically, they are using a new app to spread the word. In its second annual National Day of Unplugging, Reboot Link: http://rebooters.net/ , a New York-based nonprofit, is working with VolunteerMatch Link: http://www.volunteermatch.org/ in San Francisco, to encourage this "digital detox," starting Friday. It's a slow growing movement to return to the day of reconnecting with friends and family --- in person. While apps like FourSquare allow us to "check-in," alerting people where we are and what we are doing, this new Reboot app will do just the opposite --inform your online network that youwill not be available online Link: http://www.tfdnews.com/news/2011/02/15/80481-tanya-schevitz-missed-connection-take-digital-detox.htm for the day. "Believe me, we get the irony of using a high-tech app to announce a

low-tech day," said Tanya Schevitz, with Reboot Link: http://sanfrancisco.cbslocal.com/2011/02/27/san-francisco-nonprofit-calls-for-a-day-away-from-technology/ . "But there's not a better way to tell your

followers that you won't be on Twitter of Facebook."
